nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            If you want to contribute with a new extension, we strongly suggest you to host it in the Quarkiverse Hub.
          
          
            
            If you want to contribute a new extension, we strongly suggest you to host it in the Quarkiverse Hub.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -805,9 +805,15 @@ If the extension solves a general problem, it is very handy for Quarkus users to
 But this comes with some responsibility for you, keeping it up to date with Quarkus minor releases (every month or so at the moment).
 When in doubt, have a conversation with the community in the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group]. We can make a collective decision.
 
-[NOTE]
-As for now, the process to propose a new extension is not defined yet.
-Your best chance is to present your extension on the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group] and wait for an official invitation to join the Quarkus Platform.
+If you want to contribute with a new extension, we strongly suggest you to host it in the Quarkiverse Hub.

nodes.bodyText: Actually the correct is contribute to: https://dictionary.cambridge.org/us/dictionary/english/contribute-to-sth
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -805,9 +805,15 @@ If the extension solves a general problem, it is very handy for Quarkus users to
 But this comes with some responsibility for you, keeping it up to date with Quarkus minor releases (every month or so at the moment).

-[NOTE]

-Your best chance is to present your extension on the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group] and wait for an official invitation to join the Quarkus Platform.
+If you want to contribute with a new extension, we strongly suggest you to host it in the Quarkiverse Hub.

nodes.bodyText:
Well it depends what you mean:

"contribute to a new extension" means the extension already exists and you want to contribute to it
"contribute a new extension" means adding a new extension as a contribution

nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            We'll take care provisioning a new repository and set it up to our tooling.
          
          
            
            We'll take care of provisioning a new repository and set it up to our tooling.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -805,9 +805,15 @@ If the extension solves a general problem, it is very handy for Quarkus users to
 But this comes with some responsibility for you, keeping it up to date with Quarkus minor releases (every month or so at the moment).
 When in doubt, have a conversation with the community in the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group]. We can make a collective decision.
 
-[NOTE]
-As for now, the process to propose a new extension is not defined yet.
-Your best chance is to present your extension on the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group] and wait for an official invitation to join the Quarkus Platform.
+If you want to contribute a new extension, we strongly suggest you to host it in the Quarkiverse Hub.
+
+*Quarkiverse Hub*
+
+link:https://github.com/quarkiverse[Quarkiverse Hub] is the GitHub organization that provides repository hosting (including build, CI and release publishing setup) for Quarkus extension projects contributed by the community.
+You can get started by creating an link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/new/choose[Extension Request] issue (check first if one wasn't already submitted link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/labels/kind%2Fextension-proposal[here]) and asking to lead it.
+We'll take care provisioning a new repository and set it up to our tooling.

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if we should somehow say that we give the keys of the repository to the requester?

+We'll take care provisioning a new repository and set it up to our tooling.
+

nodes.bodyText: What key are you referring to? The repository owner has limited access to the repository settings AFAIK

nodes.bodyText:
Well it's more than people are totally independent to manage their project and releases. I think it's an important factor when taking the decision of Quarkiverse vs my own repo.
But maybe it's not worth it. I'll let you judge of that. Feel free to merge if you don't think it's necessary.

nodes.bodyText: I see, that's a good idea and a nice motivation to use Quarkiverse. I reworded it a bit, let me know how that looks now

+

+You can get started by creating an link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/new/choose[Extension Request] issue (check first if one wasn't already submitted link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/labels/kind%2Fextension-proposal[here]) and asking to lead it.

@@ -805,9 +805,22 @@ If the extension solves a general problem, it is very handy for Quarkus users to
 But this comes with some responsibility for you, keeping it up to date with Quarkus minor releases (every month or so at the moment).
 When in doubt, have a conversation with the community in the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group]. We can make a collective decision.
 
-[NOTE]
-As for now, the process to propose a new extension is not defined yet.
-Your best chance is to present your extension on the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group] and wait for an official invitation to join the Quarkus Platform.
+If you want to contribute a new extension, we strongly suggest you to host it in the Quarkiverse Hub.
+
+*Quarkiverse Hub*
+
+link:https://github.com/quarkiverse[Quarkiverse Hub] is the GitHub organization that provides repository hosting (including build, CI and release publishing setup) for Quarkus extension projects contributed by the community.
+
+You can get started by creating an link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/new/choose[Extension Request] issue (check first if one wasn't already submitted link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/labels/kind%2Fextension-proposal[here]) and asking to lead it.
+
+We'll take care of provisioning a new repository and set it up to:
+
+- Be supported by our tooling;
+- Publish the documentation you produce for your extension in the Quarkiverse website;

nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - Give you the freedom to manage the project and releases to Maven central as you like.
          
          
            
            - Give you the freedom to manage the project and release to Maven Central as you like.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -805,9 +805,22 @@ If the extension solves a general problem, it is very handy for Quarkus users to
 But this comes with some responsibility for you, keeping it up to date with Quarkus minor releases (every month or so at the moment).
 When in doubt, have a conversation with the community in the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group]. We can make a collective decision.
 
-[NOTE]
-As for now, the process to propose a new extension is not defined yet.
-Your best chance is to present your extension on the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/quarkus-dev[Quarkus Google Group] and wait for an official invitation to join the Quarkus Platform.
+If you want to contribute a new extension, we strongly suggest you to host it in the Quarkiverse Hub.
+
+*Quarkiverse Hub*
+
+link:https://github.com/quarkiverse[Quarkiverse Hub] is the GitHub organization that provides repository hosting (including build, CI and release publishing setup) for Quarkus extension projects contributed by the community.
+
+You can get started by creating an link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/new/choose[Extension Request] issue (check first if one wasn't already submitted link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/labels/kind%2Fextension-proposal[here]) and asking to lead it.
+
+We'll take care of provisioning a new repository and set it up to:
+
+- Be supported by our tooling;
+- Publish the documentation you produce for your extension in the Quarkiverse website;
+- Configure your extension to use the link:https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-ecosystem-ci#quarkus-ecosystem-ci[Quarkus Ecosystem CI] to build against the latest Quarkus Core changes;
+- Give you the freedom to manage the project and releases to Maven central as you like.
